intro: Oncostemum buxifolium, commonly known as the boxleaf oncostemum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and dark green, leathery leaves that resemble those of boxwood. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and as a decorative plant in horticulture.
